title: BBC Local Live: Leicestershire on Tuesday 1 November 2016 - BBC News
summary: three injured as car mounts pavement .
coroner halts m1 wrong-way crash inquest .
150 more police officers to get tasers .
police continue to question two men suspected of murder .
tuilagi and williams expected return for harlequins clash .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from an extended leicestershire local live - updates will start again on wednesday at 08:00 .

documents.title: 'major delays ' on buses caused by humberstone road crash
text: attn : due to an rta on humberstone gate east there will delays on our services in and around leicester this evening .
apologies - lr
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: doctors working with police
text: currently on scene at incident in # humberstone leic 's crews & @ twitterid dr 's are working with @ twitterid to manage scene & help patients
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: emergency services at the scene
text: this was the moment police and ambulance crews arrived at the humberstone gate crash scene
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: crash affecting several bus routes
text: leicester service update leicester city centre .
due to an incident humberstone gate has been closed in the city
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: smashed windscreen of car on bishop street
text: this is the car behind the police cordon on bishop street .
the windscreen looks smashed at the bottom
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: roads closed after crash
text: police have now published some information on the crash on humberstone gate .
they say they were called just before 17:00 to a report of a vehicle colliding with pedestrians .
humberstone gate is closed , from its junction with charles street to its junction with wharf street south .
yeoman street is also closed .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police cordon around car on bishop street
text: there 's a police cordon around this vehicle following the crash .
it 's on bishop street near town hall square .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: car 'collided with vans '
text: `` i was walking along charles street and halford street when i heard a screeching car .
i had to move out of the way for a black hyundai coupe-type car that entered halford street the wrong way down the road .
it mounted the kerb at speed , went along halford street , collided with two vans , carried on at speed , and then turned along granby street and we heard a lot of commotion . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: humberstone gate crash : eyewitness 'scared '
text: `` i was on the side where the car drove over people .
i was scared .
i only just got out of the way .
everyone was just scurrying everywhere , like they did n't know what to do .
there was quite a lot ( of panic ) . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: humberstone gate crash : 'smashed windscreen '
text: some eye witnesses have spoken to our reporters at the scene - one says he saw a car driving erratically .
another said the car 's windscreen was smashed .
we 've heard the car was then seen driving the wrong way along halford street smashing into the sides of other vehicles .
it 's thought the car has since been abandoned .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: road closed after crash
text: i 'm still waiting to hear from the police about their involvement in this crash - they have clearly closed the road .

documents.title: three injured after car mounts pavement
text: i 've just spoken to the ambulance service about what 's happened - they say they were called following reports of a car mounting the pavement on humberstone gate .
three people have been injured - one person seriously .
they have a paramedic team and doctors there now .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: crash in leicester
text: this is the scene on charles street right now
witnesses have told us at least two people were hit by a car .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: suspected serious incident in leicester
text: i 'm just hearing there 's been an `` incident '' on charles street in leicester where a car has mounted the pavement near primark .
there are two ambulances and four police cars at the scene - it sounds like this could be serious .
more news to follow on this .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: deadline for charter street arrests
text: i 've just spoken to leicestershire police about the two men arrested on sus of murdering a man who was found dead on charter street
i was told detectives have until this evening to release or charge the men , who 've been in custody since saturday .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tasers for local neighbourhood officers
text: of the 150 officers to be trained with tasers about 100 will be in the patrol and resolutions team - they are generally the first to respond to incidents .
the remaining 50 to be trained will be local neighbourhood officers .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'quicker and more effective ' policing
text: training and equipping an additional 150 leicestershire officers with ced capability will enable us to respond more quickly and effectively with the appropriate resources required by any given incident .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: only specialist officers currently have tasers
text: at the moment the only police officers in leicestershire with tasers are those in the east midlands operational support services unit ( emopps ) .
there 's 388 of them covering the whole of the east midlands .

assistant chief constable phil kay says that if there is an incident in leicestershire where a taser is needed it 's often the emopps firearms team who get called out to it - he thinks this is n't the best way .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: more police to carry tasers
text: leicestershire police are going to equipp 150 more officers with a taser in the new year .
they say it will increase public and officer safety .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: coroner questions wrong-way procedure
text: the coroner at the inquest into the m1 deaths also criticised leicestershire police 's procedure for dealing with vehicles travelling the wrong way .
mr newman had driven on the wrong side of the road through the north-west of the county on the a42 before joining the m1 .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: professor disputes calls for unitary authority
text: not everyone agrees with county councillor rosita page 's suggestion that borough and district councils could be scrapped - professor colin copus from de montfort university says it would mean fewer councillors with more work to do .
he also says it 's `` nonsense '' that this would improve democracy .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: led switch already well under way
text: they wo n't have to replace all the bulbs this month - that would be a big job ( i struggle with just my house ! )
switching to led bulbs actually started in 2014 but it 's set to be complete in loughborough very soon .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: loughboorugh lights become energy- efficient
text: a light-bulb moment in loughborough literally .
the town is becoming the first in the county to have all its streetlights replaced with energy saving , cost-cutting led bulbs later this month .
now that 's a bright idea .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: foxes ' algerian duo get international call-up
text: riyad mahrez and islam slimani have been named in the algeria squad to face nigeria later this month .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: new venue overlooks ashby canal
text: a new cafe is to be built at bosworth marina thanks to a £ 16,000 grant from a european pot of money .
author: Hinckley Times

documents.title: police had no road response team
text: the three police forces criticised by the coroner at the inquest were leicestershire , warwickshire and nottinghamshire .
the issue with leicestershire is that the force did n't have a road response team out after 01:00 - the crash happened at 02:00 .
police have n't responded to the criticism .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police criticised for m1 wrong-way crash
text: father-of-one michael luciw had been travelling southbound on the m1 in a van being driven by andy harrington .
they were hit head-on by albert newman 's mazda premacy ,
mr luciw and mr newman , both from nottingham , died at the scene of the crash .

documents.title: driver had been dementia patient
text: the inquest today heard mr newman had been a dementia patient and got onto the motorway the wrong way at j9 of the m42 in the early hours of october 12 last year .
he travelled onto the a42 and then the m1 , where the crash happened between j24a and j25 ( nottingham ) .
leicestershire and nottinghamshire police , who were criticised by the coroner along with warwickshire police , say they will not comment at this stage .
the inquest continues in december .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: man drove wrong way for 30 miles
text: albert newman , from nottingham , drove the wrong way for 30 miles on the m42 , the a42 and the m1 before crashing into a van , killing michael luciw .
at their inquest , warwickshire , leicestershire and nottinghamshire police forces were all criticised .
the coroner adjourned the hearing so officers could answer more questions .
author: Ben Truslove
BBC News Online

documents.title: councillor calls for council cull
text: conservative county councillor rosita page says it would be very `` simple to have one council '' .

documents.title: call to scrap borough and district councils
text: this is conservative leicestershire county councillor rosita page - she 's also a district councillor in market harborough
she used to think district and borough councils were good as local decisions were made locally .
but now she thinks they should be scrapped .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rugby : return of tuilagi and williams
text: manu tuilagi and mike williams are expected to be available in time for the premiership clash with harlequins on 20 november .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: m1 'wrong way ' crash inquest stopped
text: the coroner has halted an inquest into how an 87-year-old man drove the wrong way down the m1 - killing himself and a 27-year-old man .
the hearing had just heard strong criticism of three police forces in the way they handled both the incident and the events running up to it .
the rest of the inquest 's been put on hold so the coroner can gather more information about what happened .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: poppy box thief caught on cctv
text: here 's the moment a man steals a poppy collection tin from a newsagents on russell street in loughborough
it happened on friday - so far police have n't made any arrests but are appealing to the public for information .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : temporary lights in loughborough
text: # loughborough @ twitterid carrying out emergency repairs on derby rd .
temporary lights at the derby rd/belton rd/alan moss rd junction .
avoid .
thanks for the alert .
we were heading that way , but will come in from the other side .
a timely and useful warning .
glad to help les !
simply twitter at its very best .
the warning came through direct to my 'phone alerts .
beats me exactly how though ?
would n't be so bad if they stopped just standing around and got on with the job

documents.title: inquest hears from van driver
text: the van driver carrying michael luciw has spoken at the inquest , saying : `` i saw headlights , i swerved slightly , next minute it was all over . ''
author: Amy Harris
Reporter, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: m1 crash death inquest : wrong-way driver had no licence
text: the inquest hears albert newman , 87 , who was driving the wrong way , had his licence revoked for medical reasons in 2013 .
author: Amy Harris
Reporter, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: most people 'unaffected ' by prescription changes
text: the ccg says it made the decision to stop prescribing over-the-counter medicine after working with healthwatch leicestershire - created to represent the views of the local community .
it said healthwatch leicestershire thinks the majority of people would n't be unaffected by the changes to paracetamol prescription .
please let me know what you think - will it affect you ?
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: prescription change 'will help save millions '
text: dr richard palin is from the east leicestershire and rutland clinical commissioning group and is also a gp .
he said : `` as a ccg we need to find £ 18m in savings this year .
`` it costs the nhs around three times as much to prescribe these medicines than it does for people to buy them at the pharmacy . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: gp 's to stop prescribing over-the-counter medication
text: as of yesterday most people in east leicestershire and rutland can no longer be prescribed medicines by their gp if they are available over the counter at pharmacies and supermarkets .
that 's things like cold medicine and paracetamol .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : lane blocked near hospital
text: accident blocking a lane into the city on aylestone road next to the hospital

documents.title: witness arrives at inquest into colleague 's death
text: andy harrington has also arrived in court - he was driving the van that crashed that night in october last year
michael luciw was his passenger .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: family arrive at court
text: the inquest is happening at rutland and north leicestershire coroner 's court in loughborough .
here 's a family member of michael luciw arriving this morning
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: inquest into m1 crash deaths
text: the inquest into the deaths of two men killed in a crash on the m1 in leicestershire starts today .
michael luciw and albert newman died when the vehicles they were travelling in collided on the southbound carriageway - mr newman was driving in the wrong direction .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: appeal costs council thousands
text: the authority rejected the planning application but a government inspector overturned the decision .
oadby and wigston borough council then spent £ 18,000 appealing that decision at the high court and the court of appeal .
councillor john boyce says the outcome has left him `` disappointed '' and `` frustrated '' .
he said : `` the next thing we need to do is try to get the best development possible on that site . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cottage farm 'not in the plan '
text: oadby and wigston borough council argued cottage farm was n't in the local plan it had already put together to meet house-building targets .
councillor john boyce says : `` we have a plan - it was adopted in 2010 and required about 90 homes per year .
`` we have a direction for growth in wigston , which will take the majority of those houses - then a planning application came in for cottage farm , which in our opinion was outside that plan . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: green light for 150 new homes in oadby
text: after two years and thousands of pounds , a leicestershire council has lost its epic battle with the government over a controversial housing scheme .
oadby and wigston borough council went to the courts when an inspector overturned its decision to reject 150 homes just off the a6 .
the judges have now found there 's no reason to quash the inspector 's ruling on cottage farm and the development can go ahead .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: foxes news conference
text: claudio ranieri and andy king are due to speak to the media this afternoon .
you 'll be able to see key quotes and headlines on local live and our twitter feed from 17:30 .
author: BBC Leicester Sport

documents.title: bridgen fails to block vaz appointment
text: a bit of politics for you now - leicester east mp keith vaz has survived a bid to stop him getting a new parliamentary committee role .
a fellow leicestershire mp , andrew bridgen , had tried to block his latest appointment to the commons justice committee but his bid failed by 203 votes to seven .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest leicestershire headlines
text: latest leicestershire headlines
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: advice for copenhagen-bound foxes fans
text: leicestershire police have tweeted a helpful government link with advice if you 're planning on going to copenhagen to watch leicester city in the champions league tomorrow
@ lcfc fans traveling to copenhagen this week , here 's some important travel advice :
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: did local football coach win ?
text: efaz ahmed 's story got him shortlisted in the prince 's trust young achiever category at the pride of britain awards .
so did he win ?
well the ceremony was held last night and , according to the daily mirror who sponsor the event , he was beaten by francesca brown who set up goals4girls in manchester .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: how he proved the teachers wrong
text: efaz is already a prince 's trust ambassador and there 's 400 boys involved in his football academy that runs here at goals in evington
he told bbc radio leicester when he was at school one teacher said he was `` useless '' and that he 'd spend his life cleaning toilets .
now look at him !
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: leicester man shortlisted for national award
text: a really nice story for you now about a local man nominated for a pride of britain award .
efaz ahmed was kicked out of school when he was 13 and found himself in a world of gangs and drugs .
why the award nomination then ?
well he turned his life around , overcoming crime , a major eye injury and depression .
he then set up a football academy to try to stop other young people following his previous path .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : today 's weather outlook
text: watch : today 's weather outlook
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: missing woman found
text: yesterday i told you about the missing 19-year-old carole hardacre - police say she has now been found safe and well .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: update on charter street murder investigation
text: to start with today an update on the three men that were arrested after a body was found on charter street in leicester on saturday .
one of the men has been released with no further action .
the other two , aged 34 and 55 , are still being questioned on sus of murder .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live news coverage
text: blimey - it 's november !
where is the year going ?
i hope you 're well this tuesday morning - i 'll be writing the updates on leicestershire local live today with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
if you want to get in touch with me you can send an email or use facebook or twitter .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live
